snippet: It’s unfortunate that gay figures as serious, intelligent and well-intentioned as Anderson Cooper seems to be are still so conflicted.
abstract: Op-Ed article by writer and critic Daniel Mendelsohn reflects on Anderson Cooper's coming out as gay, calling the disclosure both worthy and troubling; laments that someone who appears to be as serious, intelligent, well-intentioned and progressive as Cooper can still seem so conflicted about publicly acknowledging his sexuality.
lead_paragraph: It’s unfortunate that gay figures as serious, intelligent and well-intentioned as Anderson Cooper seems to be are still so conflicted.
